This is one of the only games some of my friends play, so I'm kinda forced to buy it every year. Tried telling them to try other things, but they don't seem to care. If you're buying this for the campaign or zombies; steer clear. They're both dogwater. Campaign was rushed due to Activision false advertising last year that MW2 would be the last CoD for many years, and then rushing this out. It's not the developers fault. Activision wants to milk the absolute hell out of this to keep making people spend money on microtransactions that are all over this stuff, and in some regards; making the game pay-to-win. The Zombies is just outbreak, but even more barren and lacking any real content. I do quite like the multiplayer. Never been someone who cares about K/D or competitive, and I'll take SBMM over always being thrown into tryhard lobbies like I did back in the older CoD's. The movement and gunplay is about like MW2019 which is by far the best the gunplay has been in my opinion, period; as a person who has played all of them from MW2-Bo2, and then returned for MW2019. It's just so fluid and fast and just like I want it. The problems just come into play with the pre-gameplay experience. UI is a complete mess. Takes forever to get into the multiplayer menu and even then its so ludicrously convoluted. I have no idea why they changed it from the vertical panel menu that Modern Warfare 2019 had. Apparently this is MWIII ran in MWII's launcher which is kind of ridiculous, but I mean, with how rushed this is; it's very easy to see why. Another big issue is that the shaders have to recompile literally every time that the game opens. Also that it updates very frequently like MW2019 did; prompting me to constantly restart. These were issues in MW2019, and they still appear to be completely unfixed. It's a bug they know about, and Activision has not told the developers to do anything about it. Rush a game; then not do ♥♥♥♥ all about the minute things they need to fix. I really do not get it. Why can't you just; release one game, refine it, and then once it's fully set up properly; then you can just move onto developing the other, using the framework you built, and the bugs ironed out? Obviously we live in a world where a lot of developers are just forced to rush games out, and because a new game is already being worked on once one is released; they must divert all their attention to developing the new game, and maintaining online content for the current one, but is it really THAT hard for companies to just; release ONE game and support it exclusively for a year or two while it's refined, and THEN work on the next game after those two years are up? I don't get how this is such a difficult concept. I have no hope that this will be rectified when Microsoft acquires this game. Take some lessons from Forza Horizon 5; that game is supported for a long time, and while it has its own problems; at least it gets care put into it. Obviously this is not worth the money. Some people are gonna have a hard time avoiding this game since they have friends who play it and/or streamers especially often can't just stop playing their most popular game. Obviously that's why these companies do not care. It sucks there's not more ♥♥♥♥ going into Government interventions, as it's obvious ♥♥♥♥ like this is terrible for consumers. Might be preaching to a void, and contributing to the problem, but holy ♥♥♥♥ I'm tired of this. EDIT: Played a little bit more, and holy ♥♥♥♥; I'm so far behind others, because apparently MW2 levels carry over, and I did not play MW2 at all. So unfortunately; everyone else just automatically has good weapons with attachments right out of the gate, and I'm stuck with weapons that have severe recoil and do not really work well. I admit I'm ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ at this game and only had around a .90 KD or so on MW2019 (Which I bet is largely because I played Shipment and nothing else). This game is not very fun. Also the SBMM is really setting in, and it feels like I'm playing against people well above my skill level. Not blaming other players. I am ass at this game. It's the fault of the algorithms. I wish you could just toggle a setting to turn SBMM on and off, just at least so I can test it out. Or at least give us a game mode to just.. casually play the game please. The way it stands; I'm refunding this game. It's not worth $70 at all.

Mixed Feelings on COD MW3: A Steam User's Perspective Review: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 (COD MW3) on Steam presents a mixed bag of exhilarating experiences and frustrating issues. Let's break it down: Pros: Open World Zombies: The open-world zombies mode in COD MW3 is a thrilling highlight. The game offers a rich blend of missions and unlockables that keep you engaged for hours. However, once you've completed all the missions and unlocked everything, the replay value diminishes significantly. Extensive Arsenal and Customization: A major plus is the vast selection of weapons, camos, attachments, characters, and skins. Impressively, these elements are carried over from previous COD games, offering a sense of continuity and reward for long-time fans. Quality of Life Improvements: The developers deserve praise for their commitment to improving the game. Frequent bug fixes and updates show a dedication to enhancing the player experience. Cons: Persistent Party Bug for Steam Users: A significant drawback for Steam players is a bug preventing them from joining other players' parties. This issue, unique to the Steam platform and absent on , has persisted since the game's release without a resolution. It's a known issue, widely reported, yet frustratingly unresolved. Ongoing Minor Bugs: The game suffers from various small bugs that impact gameplay. For instance, there was a week-long issue where players couldn't save any gun with the Golden Enigma camo. Although this particular bug has been fixed, the presence of these glitches can be annoying. In summary, COD MW3 on Steam offers a robust and enjoyable gaming experience, especially with its open-world zombies and extensive customization options. However, the enjoyment is marred by persistent bugs, particularly the party-joining issue for Steam users, which remains a significant frustration. The game shines in many areas but could benefit from more attentive bug resolution to provide a smoother experience.

There are many, Many bad reviews for this game both here and on youtube. Basically people have said this is essentially a patch for MW2 with old maps and very little difference. And whilst that might be true (And for all intents and purposes it seems to be) I never played MW2 and have not played COD since the re-release of MW. As such I'm playing this game as if MW2 didn't exist and I have to say that I'm really impressed with this game. The shooting mechanics are really tight, Its rare I'm thinking "Thats not right, I'm sure I got him" Everything seems to be absolutely on point. There are a number of game modes all of which have been fun to play so far and my introduction to Modern Warfare Zombies has been excellent. I've enjoyed everything I've tried so far and its the best arcade shooter out there. BF2042 is complete garbage compared to this and it used to be the competitor with slightly more realism but now its just a weaker competitor all round. If you're looking to buy this and didn't buy MW2 then I can only recommend it. If you've got MW2 already then this may very well be a skip over this game!

My partner, however, loves shooters and I slowly started resenting them fow how much time he would spend playing games, starting at big animated b00bas, and talking to anime uwu girls online. He still sleeps on the couch, but at least we can spend more time together and when I hear some anime chick trying to UWU his ears off I can use voice to screech like a banshee and then recite the Curse of Ra in a distorted, demonically possessed voice.

For the amount of time I have spent on the game there are issues. Separate your games. It is impossible to get all the achievements unless I own all the games under the title. For a triple A game company, I shouldn't be reporting 10+ issues within the first two weeks (not to mention how bad steam and activision support is). This game has a lot of bugs and glitches that relatively get patched quickly, but in turn some times hinder your gameplay - ex. MWZ, the zombies for MWIII, has a lack of zombies funny enough. In a game where I expect to kill thousands and have a problem staying alive, I would be lucky to see hundreds (600+) and to cap it off, they nerf your EXP if you kill more than 750 zombies. They made the exfil super easy after they realized people could just farm it over and over again. It's just not exciting and I hope they have plans to bring round based zombies with Easter eggs back into the game. $70 is the biggest ripoff. You shouldn't expect so many things wrong with the game. Also I have heard many people complain this is just a DLC for MWII which I can see. Like... why are these guns in the game? I only got 36 guns in this game wtf? Yes, I understand I can unlock the MWII weapons without purchasing the game, but its ridiculous how bad they are too. Anyway.. This and EA games are the scam of the century.

Very good game as long as it doesn't crash. If it does crash, heres what you need to do. Verify the integrity of the game files. If it is missing 67 game files like other people are missing then the best thing to do is uninstall COD, re-install it and then verify the integrity of the game files. If there are no missing files then you're probably good to start playing. If there is a different problem related to crashes then i recommend asking somebody else for help because i'm writing this from my own experience. Have a good day and enjoy the game :)

Honestly, this game sucks. You are permanently slowed in multiplayer because every grenade, explosive, or some bullet has slowing abilities. It is extremely frustrating. We can then go to spawns... more than half the maps are from a game 10 years ago, you know what still sucks? The spawns. I have spawned with my gun facing the back of an enemy 10 feet away dozens of times, and the same has happened with them spawning behind me. If you're playing on M&KB just forget it. The controller users will win most gun fights because their gun follows your head. So prepare to spend hours practicing your aiming so you can have fun and not lose every gunfight. Oh, if you want to have fun for multiple games in a row, DO NOT HAVE A GOOD GAME AND POP OFF! If you pop off, your next 3+ games will bump your SBMM so high it feels like you're playing a different game. Lastly, if you have friends with a higher SBMM, forget having fun. You won't. The game really sucks. There are plenty of better FPS games out there, made by smaller companies.

This review will primarily be based around Modern Warfare III, and it's "Search and Destroy" game mode. Many of the maps are re-implemented from previous CoD instalments, which sounds cool, however, many of these maps over implement advanced movement and verticality to every surface known to man. You can climb just about everything, from trees, to buildings, to cliffs, to heavy machinery, not to mention all of the new pixel angles and otherwise implemented via the new models, which provides players with near instant spawn peaks, and a million plus angles to worry about while traversing the map. Which in of itself isn't terrible, I can get over it. Although, the real issue comes in when discussing the new equipment item, the "covert shoes" which make all movement related sounds literally, and completely silent (even tactical sprinting through bogs of water), removing all audio feedback from the player, making it a near game of luck when turning a corner. Furthermore, due to the inability to hear players, the best strategies revolve sprinting around the map, and if you dare stop, the odds are your enemy hasn't and will find you from any of the 12 sight lines toward your current position, making death frustrating as in many circumstances it is not reasonably possible for a player to clear all sight lines before proceeding, or before being spotted through the use of another sight line and or pixel angle, and or being ran up to from behind by a literally silent opponent wearing an equipment item of which is not particularly fun to obtain. Which brings us to the next topic, the grind. Just about every CoD game has had some serious grinding, which isn't an intrinsically negative aspect. However, for even the process of unlocking just about any item of equipment (equipment referring to any item that provides an impact on the game play experience, for example a weapon) requires a ridiculous amount of silly daily challenges such as getting 2 slide kills while in "tactical stance" in 3 separate matches, and at the time of writing, the challenges are bugged most of the time and simply cannot be completed, requiring you to wait another real life day before trying again. Now, the most disappointing part of all, Zombies, it's meh... It's like DMZ from MWII but Zombies, it's not bad, not great. I didn't personally have a great time playing it, so do not expect a classic Zombies experience. In my opinion this is the worst CoD ever released, somehow worse than advanced warfare. I was excited for this game as I thoroughly enjoyed the previous two instalments. Even more so considering the massive improvement between them. This game had immense potential coming from the foundation of MWII however the designers decided to rip up the foundation, and throw away many of the principles and otherwise that made MWII fun, and replace it with so many new ridiculous features, from maps to equipment. 3/10. Buy this game on a heavy sale, or wait for the next CoD.

I can't help but feel a sense of nostalgia about Call of Duty: Modern Warfare III. Sure, the game has seen its fair share of criticism, but for me and my dad, it's a trip down memory lane that's absolutely priceless. Back in the Xbox 360 days, we spent countless hours engrossed in the original Modern Warfare 2 and Modern Warfare 3, and this latest installment brings back all those cherished memories. Despite the divided opinions, I find myself thoroughly enjoying the game. The familiar maps, the intense firefights, and the adrenaline-pumping action are like a virtual time machine. It's not just a game; it's a connection to the past, a shared experience with my dad that spans years. Modern Warfare III might not be everyone's cup of tea, but for those of us who remember the sheer joy of those early COD days, this installment is a heartfelt salute to the roots of the franchise. It's more than pixels on a screen; it's a bond, a story, and a testament to the enduring magic of the Modern Warfare series.

Product received for free As a Disclaimer, this game absolutely is a ripoff of DLC being charged for $70. The campaign is actually terrible and everything in every mode is very noticeably thrown together out of as many spare parts as could be found to put a game together, so if you're hesitant to pick this up then save your money. This is the game we were supposed to get last year and it's stupid of Activision to give it to us under a new price tag for a game that just reverts a lot of IW's stupid changes in last year's game. With that said, I'm actually surprised how much better this game plays and feels over last year's entry. Sledgehammer I've always believed are the kings of feedback and they really took MW2 and refined it to a razor's edge with MUCH faster and more fluid movement that reminds me so much of Titanfall. It feels so nimble and snappy and complimenting them are the guns with fantastic feedback (audio, time to kill, recoil feel, etc.) that make this one of the most punchy and satisfying CoD's in a while. Zombies also works surprisingly well as a DMZ spinoff, even if it could use a lot of refinement. It's a chill mode to grind guns outside of MP's sweatfest, promotes cooperative play and scavenging, then once you get into Contracts, they remind me a lot of Cold War's Outbreak with plenty of other neat ideas thrown in. It's not a whole lot right now and needs some tweaks to match times, gear progression, optimization with Squad Fills and permanent loot solutions, but what's here is still fun and engaging if you're interested in DMZ and/or Cold War's Outbreak mode. In summary, the MP is incredibly fun with an engaging gear unlock mechanic (which magically, somehow, convinced the CoD community to play objectives for a change), the Zombies is different but chill, unique, and even engaging with a lot of promise ahead, but the campaign is a real stinker and not worth your time. If you really wanna play this MP I strongly recommend waiting for a deep sale or waiting until you try the updates to Warzone to see if the new mechanics justify it enough personally for you for a purchase. Zombies I'd give it a season update or two before considering it.

One of the worst FPS multiplayer games I have ever played. While some of the gameplay and unlocks can be extremely enjoyable it will never shadow over the unending number of unnecessary mechanics and microtransactions littering this once respected franchise. The amount of obscure unlock conditions or disgustingly out of touch skins is honestly headache inducing. Let me mention a few mechanics that completely ruin this games multiplayer integrity due to how abusable they are. • Sliding • Sliding with full momentum after half a foot of sprint, • gun mounting • full unchecked gun customization • full ADS control while dropping prone • dropshotting • covert boots - a piece of equipment that eliminates all player noise made from movement • player movement speed (I am not kidding they can move 25mph in full tactical gear) • knifing coupled with ludicrous strafing and movement speed • Strafe speed despite ADS'ing • tactical grenade spamming • slide cancelling • Corner flyouts All these things listed are in the game because the developers have zero vision. Thus, the game is an amalgamation of player wants and demands across years and years of COD. All these different wants from all these different fans, so much mixed reception has led Call of Duty into being such a mess of design. An absolute cash cow that you should only play if you have no respect for yourself.

I love Call of Duty. I've played it since Call of Duty 2 and Call of Duty 4. I've always been a PC player with Keyboard and Mouse input. Ever since Modern Warfare 2019 and the much needed engine upgrade to Call of duty, I feel Call of Duty has been worth playing again. Its fun and its addicting when you are having a good time and everything is patched and working. But Modern Warfare 3 is everything wrong with Call of Duty and its sad decline in terms of fun, the game working as intended and a company who is getting greedier and greedier, failing to realise why people are giving them negative feedback even when the game is playable. Its down to broken promises, failure to listen to community feedback and opinion and pure incompetence and greed. Modern Warfare 3 is what Modern Warfare 2 should have been in the first place. When it comes to the Multiplayer, it is fun and works when it works. They fixed most issues and problems that were present in Modern Warfare 2 that Infinity Ward refused to listen too or remedy. This shows on my Steam account because after around 30 hours at launch of MW2 before Season 1 even occurred, I stopped playing MW2 2022 for good and didn't play it again. The big problem people have (me included) is it feels like you are paying full price ($70) for a DLC patch that basically fixed MW2 2022 into a state of what it should have already been anyway. This rubs a lot of people the wrong way. The multiplayer is given poor reviews and is often said to be terrible. In reality, the Multiplayer is decent and feels like MW2019 again in terms of fun, but once again Modern Warfare 3 suffers from a new studio (Sledgehammer Games) who say they are listening to the community but it feels like they really aren't at all and are doing what they think is right or best instead. I will outline the Pros and Cons of this game below: Pros - Multiplayer works well and is a step up from MW2 2022 but needs more content from new seasons to feel worth it once again - Zombies DMZ mode is really good and fun and a laid back way to level up guns and earn battle pass exp if you are getting frustrated from multiplayer games and trying to level guns with no attachments (can be extremely frustrating trust me) - The game runs very well on PC. I get 120+ FPS on High settings. I only have the game hard crash maybe once every few days at best. Stability in performance seems to be there if you have a good PC. (I use a Intel CPU and 6700 XT GPU and play at 1440p with the game installed on a NVME SSD) - The developers add playlist updates often and based off what the community wants or prefers. Its something I guess which is a positive. Cons -SBMM or Skill Based Match Making or "Algorithm matchmaking" is still present in this game. Despite extreme community feedback about SBMM and seeing it either removed or changed so people aren't as frustrated by it so they can have fun, it seems the developers ignore any mention of SBMM feedback and refuse to say anything about it or how they can address the community about SBMM. This is rather saddening. Battlefield games and other FPS don't have such harsh SBMM like COD or none present at all. - Campaign is very lazy and was probably rushed. Most Campaign missions use DMZ maps and assets and play the same way. "Go here" or "collect a key card, open a door, go here to finish". Extremely disappointing conclusion to the MW2019/MW2/MW3 storyline. - No Crossplay on PC to play with only Keyboard and Mouse input players. This is something that was present in MW2019 and Cold War (from Treyarch). It was even in the MW3 open beta itself. But it seems it was removed at launch of MW3 and the devs have said they don't intend to allow PC players to only match with other PC players via input. This is very disappointing to me as a PC only player. - Some MW3 guns are useless and others are completely broken or busted. If you don't use what is considered "meta weapons" = you are at a huge disadvantage and will do poorer in games because of it. In the original MW2 2009 and MW3 2011, the guns were balanced very well and every gun was a 2-3 hit kill and yeah some were slightly better or worse, but you could use any gun in those games and do well (a gun meta was there back then but not as impactful as modern cod games). Also there was no SBMM in the past so you could have fun with any gun. This is no longer the case. - MW2 2022 guns that carried over into MW3 have not been updated stats/damage wise for MW3 and its 150 HP values. This means most if not all MW2 2022 guns which were not changed to accommodate MW3s increased HP values means that they often take more bullets and longer to kill enemies than MW3 guns. This is a huge con and a big issue to me because it leaves almost half of your weapon arsenal "useless" in multiplayer. There is no point using a gun like the MW2 2022 3 round burst M16 if you like it because it takes longer to kill targets than the MW3 3 round burst weapons and you're basically handicapping yourself. It seems the developers have no plans to update the MW2 guns stats for MW3 either. This is bad. - The game doesn't feel like a full priced COD game experience and just feels like a MW2 2022 DLC fully priced. I am enjoying the game a lot myself, but I cannot ignore the negatives. Its a wait for a 30-50% sale and maybe in Season 2 or 3 when the games updated or fixed, then yes, it would be worth it. Final thoughts: I just wish Call of Duty went the live service free to play route of Fortnite or Apex Legends. They could have one game thats free for everyone on all platforms and continue to build upon it forever and add seasonal content and operator skins and blueprint skins endlessly and I feel that would turn around their negative feedback they receive online at the moment. I don't think they ever will do this though sadly. The game is also anti fun with how extreme the SBMM is. Call of duty should be about fun and about enjoyment first. I feel this has gone down a lot over the years and its Activisions own fault, not ours.

I've been playing Call of Duty for a long time, the movement and the guns feel great in this game, but I have to literally work to have an OK game in this one. Whatever kind of SBMM they use in this game is killing the experience for me. After working all day, the last thing I want is to be forced into lobbies that feel like ranked matches. There is no reward for getting better at the game it feels like. Was always close to a 2kd in past titles, this one I'm at a 1.3, but my point is that the matches feel robotic and fixed. It doesn't feel like an organic experience, rivalries can't be made still in this title due to disbanding lobbies, and it just sucks the fun right out of it. I wish the devs would listen to the community and tone down the SBMM. You're going to lose another long time player of this franchise. Would I recommend? If you're new to the game, it could be fun until you get better at aiming and with movement and learn the spawns(which are broken rn), when that happens you'll be forced to play matches that feel like ranked and are sweaty as can be, over, and over, and over again... be warned. SBMM is like this in this game: Playing well the first minute of the match, all is fine. Then, they spawn someone right behind you to give them a kill even though it makes no sense because your team holds the side of the map that you're on... really crazy to be honest. That is just one of many things wrong with their SBMM system. I'll finally be moving on to a new game, because I don't have the time to sweat my butt off learning how to beat a new matchmaking system that is geared towards making me lose. I've done it the past three titles, and I'm over it. I'm not a pro by any means, but I'm also not a scrub, and it's bonkers that this is how it is. It's just not fun anymore for me. Thanks for all the great COD titles in the past, this one is it for me....

I love playing with friends, this is why I play the game, I enjoy MP however, I do not recommend this game. It is MWII without DMZ, Arguably the best mode in Modern Warfare, we are getting Warzone soon, but this is usually very sweaty and not as fun as DMZ. Zombies is Rubbish. Really boring, not as exciting as Zombies from other instalments, but Zombies was never my thing anyway. So they took away a fun mode, added a bad one, that is a mash up of both but not as good as either. The balancing has been a problem with guns acting very strangely. Pistols beating SMGs in close range, Assault rifles beating SMGs in close range, beating Marksman rifles in long range, and everything in-between, there is little reason to run anything other than an Assault rifle. Hardly any new maps... Basically this is an overpriced expansion to MWII, which you pay full game cost for... Instead, get MWII enjoy DMZ, you get a longer campaign and more epic campaign, if you reeeeeally wanna find out what happens in the campaign you can get MWIII but yeah don't expect much more.

MW3 REVIEW Very good campaign, the story was very nice and i liked the flow when the campaign tells itself through the missions. However, i feel like the campaign was very rushed and quick. Overall id rate the campaign a 7.5/10. The state of multiplayer is in a very bad position as well as zombies. Its not about the quality, the quality exceeded my expectations, its the game servers that ruin it for me. Very laggy and stutters alot and overall its not a good experience (and yes ive tried everything to fix the issue and it doesn't solve it at all). The gameplay itself however is nice and i love the game modes included. The only reason zombies and multiplayer isnt that great at all, is (like i said) because of the laggy servers. It slightly ruins the motivation to keep playing and i hope in the future this issue is fully solved. MP and MWZ = 5.5/10. Overall, MW3 is a pretty solid game, but it definitely has A TON of room for improvements. Overall my MW3 (zombies, campaign, multiplayer) rating is 7/10.

Let's go ahead and get straight to it. Does this feel like a copy and paste from last year's MW2? Yes. Straight out, yes. Does it feel like they purposely held back from releasing maps from MW2 so they could include them in MW3? Kind of. We will never know for sure. However, if the original MW2 was your absolute favorite and you loved playing on those maps, then MW3 is worth picking up. I am not going to focus my review on the negatives. You can clearly see, from the current number of negative reviews (as of 11/23/23) on Steam, this game does have its faults. I didn't buy this game for the short campaign or zombie modes. I bought it specifically to go back and essentially play the original MW2 maps, with current COD mechanics. AND IT IS ABSOLUTELY WORTH IT! Don't get me wrong, there are problems, but the overall experience is what I am enjoying. There will be matches where you completely dominate, but then others where you are the one getting dominated. It happens. Does it ruin the overall experience for me? No. Believe it or not, the movement has been improved from last year's MW2 as well. Being able to slide-cancel is fantastic and the overall movement feels as smooth as ever. Map voting is back too. A small, but welcome feature. Gun mechanics and weapon customization is a straight copy and paste from MW2, but is that a bad thing? Not necessarily because if ain't broke, don't fix it. Now, if you hated the weapon customization from MW2, you will hate it here too. It is what it is. Overall, I have enjoyed my time with MW3 multiplayer and love returning to the "new" old maps. I look forward to the future of this specific iteration of COD and hope the developers are actively listening to the complaints people have so they can improve the experience. Cheers!

I love the CoD franchise but for ♥♥♥♥'s sake, MW3 actually sucks. I get nostalgia, but the maps are not designed well for the modern movement, game play and resolutions. the reason the maps worked so well back then was because the highest quality at that time was possibly 1080p, but most played on 720p, which works because you would need a scope to actually see across the map but now you can kill someone across the map with any gun because people can play on 1440 to 4K, you can spot a single pixel from someone's model from across the entire map. Every map practically plays like Rust/Shipment due to how the modern game play is. This game truly sucks, map designs are not good anymore, they need to bring back the maps from MW2 remake to give variety (though they should bring maps back from MW 2019 also tbh, those were good too)

I literally vowed to never purchase the game. My buddy was playing and I wanted to surprise him. We played about 10 matches. The first 6 went smooth. It was actually really fun. I had about a 2.5 kd at this point. The 7th was a bear to get through but I went about even. The 8th was where I really noticed my guns had gotten weaker and the enemies bullets had gotten way stronger. I was getting 2-shot and dying, even though the game was saying I was hit with 5 hits. Meanwhile, I was unloading half a clip into the enemy team and still getting dropped. Not a skill issue. It's a game issue. BullSh** . I had the lowest ping in the lobby too so it's not about my connection. No, this is influenced by the Activision/Blizzard/Microsoft to hurt the player if they start doing too well. SBMM is a ♥♥♥*** joke. f*** this game. f*** activision. f*** cod. If you're an idiot like me and there's a tiny glimmer of hope in you that this game might not be like all the others... And you are a higher than average player... Stop yourself immediately. This game is not the one. Move on. This ones a bust.

Product refunded In the adrenaline-soaked annals of interactive warfare, Call of Duty Modern Warfare 3 emerges as a chaotic masterpiece that transcends the very essence of traditional first-person shooter experiences. Developed by the mad alchemists at Infinity Ward, this instalment catapults players into a maelstrom of military mayhem that oscillates between the sublime and the utterly nonsensical. Graphically, Modern Warfare 3 is a visual feast, with explosions that rival the intensity of a supernova and textures so hyper-realistic, I could almost feel the digital wind ruffling Captain Price's meticulously rendered beard. The sheer granularity of the bullet casings hitting the ground added a layer of authenticity that transcended the boundaries of virtual reality and flirted with the surreal. The audio design is a symphony of chaos, a cacophony of gunfire and explosions that would make Beethoven question his life choices. The thunderous roar of automatic weapons, the percussive rhythm of grenades, and the haunting echoes of distant warfare create a sensory experience that is both exhilarating and disorienting. It's as if the sound engineers went on a bender, drowning in a sea of war-themed dubstep and emerged with an auditory masterpiece. The campaign narrative, while ostensibly coherent, takes an unexpected detour into the realms of existential absurdity. Characters with the gravitas of Shakespearean actors deliver lines that oscillate between profound military strategy and the musings of a caffeinated conspiracy theorist. The plot, like a Jackson Pollock painting, is a splatter of disjointed events that somehow coalesce into a semblance of coherence, only to unravel into a tapestry of bewildering inanity. Mission objectives range from the strategic and tactical to the downright bizarre. One moment, you're executing precision airstrikes on enemy positions; the next, you find yourself engaged in an epic firefight against an army of sentient soda machines hell-bent on global carbonation domination. The boundaries between reality and fever dream blur as you navigate through urban landscapes that inexplicably transform into psychedelic discotheques, complete with neon-lit tanks and break dancing enemy soldiers. As the campaign hurtles toward its climax, the narrative dissolves into a surreal fever dream. Captain Price reveals himself to be a time-travelling bard, armed with a sniper rifle that doubles as a lute. The antagonist turns out to be a misunderstood thespian seeking recognition for his avant-garde interpretative dance performances. The final mission involves a dance-off to determine the fate of the world, with the fate of humanity hanging in the balance of a rhythmic showdown. In the end, as the credits roll, you're left questioning whether you just experienced a brilliant satire on the absurdities of modern warfare or if the entire game was an elaborate hallucination induced by an overdose of Mountain Dew and military-themed interpretative dance. Call of Duty Modern Warfare 3, a tour de force that blurs the line between genius and insanity, leaves players with a sense of bewildered satisfaction that transcends the boundaries of conventional gaming experiences.

It's a call of duty game. Honestly, I got it for the zombies, and I have had a lot of fun... BUT not without a lot of frustration: -Lag, why is there so much lag? Doesn't matter where I play. So much consistent lag, hope that gets fixed. -QOL adjustments... Why can't I see my challenges in-game? Why can't a look at my gear while in party (or waiting for a game to end)? So many small things -AI monitored chat system... I guess other games are trying it to, but know your player base, come on -$70... It's the principle, rising game prices but same quality of games, make it worth it, hash out some bugs prior to the game (instead of a million hot-fixes that forces me to update and restart my game every day I log in) It's fun, I'd say I would be happier to have bought this a few months in once it's a well-worn game, but I am content with my purchase.

MW3 Is a phenomenal game from the get go. People who haven't bought this game can still download it at no additional cost. If its one thing I give Activision credit for its for their generosity and commitment to release a quality game deserving of your hard earned cash. The geniuses at Sledgehammer games are up around the clock to bring you store content UPDATES everyday which attests to the consumer-first attitude they have at their studio. I found myself overwhelmed with the choices i have in choosing which skins to buy. I ended up buying the Exotic Tracer Pack which I myself think was a good choice. BUY NOW!

When was the last time a video game made you question whether or not what the characters are doing, what you are doing, is right? In Modern Warfare (2019), Infinity Ward shocked the world with its new reality driven campaign, in which the world feels like it has real consequences in it. Modern Warfare II (2022) does everything in it's power to undo this. It takes what was a very grounded and almost disturbing military experience and puts it back into the regular action packed military painted nonsense that comes out every other time. The campaign is alright, it just pales in comparison to it's predecessor. Not one moment in the game had me think about my actions, made me get on the edge of my seat or made me want more because it was stuff I had all seen before. Even the rehashed bits from the previous MW felt disingenuous. Not only that, I have to access MWIII (2023), a game I don't own, in order to gain access to MW2. That is a problem. I wanted to play the campaign again and had to close everything and relaunch MW3, to get to campaign menu for MW2... So yeah, just get Modern Warfare (2019) now that they don't force you to download Warzone Caldera anymore.

This is a review of how to launch and navigate the UI of Call of Duty MW3 or apparently just "Call of Duty". There is one launcher that incorporates all 3 remastered Modern Warfare games. Yet when you go in to try and launch them you have to navigate the puzzle of a UI and the game reloads itself like 5 times before you get in to MW3. Then, It somehow always gives me an advertisement to buy MW3 which is the game I am literally playing already. Then once you're in its the worst UI of all time. Then good luck figuring out what to click to get into anything. I cannot figure out how to see the different modes of multiplayer the game has. When I first tried to play zombies with my friend I couldn't figure out how to find the start game button. Good luck if you ever want to figure out where the menu is to customize your guns. If you want to try and find the settings for anything good luck. I don't think the game wants you to play it, this is the worst UI of all time. As far as the actual game goes, I really am only interested in the Zombies mode, and honestly, though I was skeptical, its pretty fun for what it is. It could definitely use tweaks but its fun.

Honestly most the reviews that you will see are just people sitting on the hate bandwagon and probably actually like the game but the popular consensus is the game is bad so they can't go against it. Now for some actual criticism: The campaign is dogwater the campaign for Destiny 2 somehow felt longer and more happened in it than this campaign. Really the campaign is a DLC. Multiplayer ain't too bad most of the matches I get are pretty normal call of duty happenings. The TTK increases the skill barrier for the game as it takes longer to kill other players so you can't just rely on a meta gun to win the battle. Zombies is by far the best addition I actually enjoy it tho I wish they didn't nerf exfils. I understand people were exploiting them for xp but it was fun to actually have a crap ton of zombies come at you as you try to escape in the helicopter and doing it in more difficult areas made it a decent challenge. Also I would love it if they implemented a item protection for internet disconnections to the zombies as it really sucks to be playing and lose everything due to lag or latency. Overall not a terrible game definitely Midtier - Good needs improvements but literally every other triple A release does too. (Don't buy it expecting something other than a modern Call of duty shooter cause that is just ignorant)

I will admit I am in the fringe minority in that I don't like Multiplayer and buy games like Battlefield and CoD strictly for single player campaigns and stuff like bot matches and instant action. That said, Battlefield V has one of the saddest campaigns out there. The very first mission makes the campaign feel like it'll have big 'battlefield moments' and this never happens in play. Campaign 1 was by far the weakest being just very weak stealth sections with a challenge that made me realize the keyboard controls for the planes is probably the worst KB+M flight controls ever made. Campaign 2's missions dragged almost as much as Campaign 1's and makes me wonder why they decided to front load two campaigns of generic stealth segments and wide open three objective maps. Campaign 3 was actually enjoyable and felt like an actual battlefield campaign. Campaign 4 was the most interesting deciding to be nearly strictly in a tank with only two brief on foot section. It also had the most interesting character dynamics and moral questions raised. Had the previous three campaigns been remade to that quality it probably would have lead to a better experience. I got it on sale for 5.86 CDN and honestly I think the campaign is just BARELY worth that price. I've played bargain bin FPS games that gripped me more than BFV's campaign did.

This game is amazing, although it has a few flaws. I personally recommend this game, 𝐏𝐑𝐎𝐒: 1. Amazing graphics 2. Destructible walls and barriers 3. You can build sandbag walls, turrets and other heavy weapons as a support, barbed wire, and a few more. 4. Amazing guns 5. Good customizations for the guns 6. Great variety of vehicles for the Japanese, American, British, and German sides 7. Destruction is very rarely randomized by AI. Most of what you see is made by a player and looks randomized. The only randomized destruction you'll see it outside of the battlefield which you barely notice. 8. Easter eggs! 9. Revival mechanics that allow you to ask for help or skip the revive. Unlike Battlefield 1, you aren't just a limp corpse, you actually have an animation and can look around with your hand outstretched while asking for help. You also have different lines depending on whether you are fighting for the Germans, British, American, or Japanese.

Let's get it started. +Incredibly beautiful. The game looks amazing, I'm not sure I've ever seen anything like this in a shooter. I had a very strong desire to set the settings to ultra and just walk around the maps on empty servers to look at this beauty. The developers' attention to detail has always been at a high level. +Specializations. The mechanics have been updated and the perks are now immediately available, but the game is still most effective in a squad, which is a plus as it's fun. The classes have been redesigned and are now better and more balanced. +Minor new mechanics and reworked old mechanics. First aid kits, ammo, supply boxes, the ability to revive a squad member, and rewards for squad points are done very well and fit into the gameplay. The absence of an actual wallhack when spotting, as in BF4, is also a big plus. +Official servers. No more sh!tty rules from stupid admins, no more permanent bans for politely telling the admins why their rules are sh!tty. It's amazing that there are no class restrictions, no nukes, no rebalancing and other idiotic things. We can just play the way we like. =Squad. Playing in a squad with friends is just as damn fun and highly effective as playing with random people in your squad is boring and unproductive. +/-Recon class. This has become much more useful. You can now spot enemies in an area with the Flare Gun and when hit. Why isn't this a real plus? The fact is that the Battlefield games have a recon class and no sniper class, which does not give us the opportunity to get the classic sniper experience. Killсam will always shows your position when you kill somebody and your rifle will never kill with a single shot on a body. +/-Maps. As I said earlier, appearance is amazing. But there are few of them and many of them are unbalanced and boring. +/-HUD settings. It's just as customizable as in BF4, but now we're finally spared from the disgusting battlelog, and we can directly join a friend without any problems. This should be in games by default so it is not a really plus and in this case DICE fixed their mistakes. -Cheaters. The official servers have only one problem - the lack of human moderation and/or a kick voting system. The anti-cheat system does not work here at all, and a couple of years ago EA initiated the free giveaway of an unlimited number of copies of the game through Amazon. As a result, even if the cheaters is banned, they can easily buy a new account on third-party sites for a very small price, or perhaps they have already created a dozen accounts for himself during that giveaway. This is a huge problem, in about half of all matches you will encounter a cheater. If you suspect cheating, but you are not sure whether to send a report, I recommend checking the player's nickname on the bfvhackers website. -Balance. Unfortunately, traditionally everything is very bad. Incredible high rate of fire + good control of some types of weapons (Type 2A, etc.), automatic shotguns (several oneshots per second), DMR, prone playstyle with a machine gun - huge advantages. The aircraft have been made even more powerful and you will die from them a lot, the situation is much worse than in BF4, because here they mainly attack infantry. DICE don't know what balance is and this game is no exception. The biggest cons. -Gadget keys. At critical moments, they may simply not work literally up to a minute. This doesn't happen often, but it's very frustrating because the game simply won't let you use your first kit. -Unlocking. Not only are newcomers forced to compete with more experienced players, but they don’t even have specializations for weapons from the start and they have to unlock them. The stupidest trend and I have no idea why all shooters have this annoying thing. -No test range. BF4 had a great test range where you could set up settings and adjust your classes. The test range in BF5 is terrible. You can't set up classes and test them, and there aren't enough interactions to fine-tune HUD and other things. -Community. It's disgusting here too. The developers deliberately added imbalanced weapons to retain the casual audience, but the garbage community here plays almost with such weapons only. -Censorship. EA suppresses free speech all the time but this is truly a new level, I have never seen anything like this. Now the chat has a censor and some of your words will be replaced with "***". FC U EA. You are trash. -Support. DICE and EA don't care about their products. There is no chance that any of the above will be fixed. I must admit that this is quite an entertaining product. If you have even one person willing to share multiplayer gameplay with you, I highly recommend it. BF5 is vastly superior to BF4 in almost every way. But the fact is that both of these games have common cons that are most important to the gameplay. A good gaming experience is a consequence of playing cooperatively with friends, and not the merit of the game itself. Therefore, playing alone is very uninteresting, boring and annoying due to the imbalance. Verdict. Objectively the game is very bad. Terrible balance and community, lots of cheaters - are the main cons that make the game unplayable. However, playing in a squad can keep you here for a while. I'd like the game to get a few patches, but since no one cares about it, I wish it dead. The "Not Recommended" was given because the game doesn't deserve the 70% positive reviews it has on Steam. I think the % should be <40.

I have about 500+ hours on PS with this game, before I 'migrated' over to PC. If anything, I think this games tale is unfortunate. It had some neat innovation regarding gameplay, like Squad-leader reinforcements and that infamous V-1, movement mechanics that not many people know about, like pressing crouch before hitting the ground when falling a moderate distance to do a combat roll to nullify fall damage, the fact that if you string sniper headshots, your characters starts counting past the third kill, the interesting weapon upgrade tree and tons more, yet it still was mostly a fart in the wind. The bar was already high in the wake of BF1 with this game, and due to terrible marketing among other blatant factors, they ♥♥♥♥ the bed since that infamous day the horrid trailer released. People on twitter can twist it any way they like, the 'diversity' inclusion of women in ALL factions is more insulting to the role of women during the Second World war then totally leaving them out. They could have had women during a 1945 Germany as Volksturm or the multiple woman battalions the Red Army had, even maybe be creative with a Resistance faction (and not just the French). Speaking of which, the fact they cut out the Red Army in development when they ceased game support, (Evident by the fact that they once accidentally had an experimental soviet machine gun in the shooting range, the LAD, 2 years ago) was the biggest missed opportunity ever. Especially because the dedicated '''''''''''DEVELOPMENT''''''''''' time for BF2042 was practically for nothing. How fun would it have been to run around with a PPsh-41 in this game? Blast people with a T-34? Play with a Panther on the Wehrmacht on a map like Kursk? Have one of the Squad-leader reinforcements be a Nebelwerfer/Katyusha strike? Have the Special tank for the soviets be a KV-2? Dogfight Bf109s with Yak-9s? Have the Red Army scream their iconic war cry when they advance as attackers during Breakthrough? A Battle of Stalingrad? Moscow? An Operation with these? Maybe even lesser known fronts like the Lapland Pocket or the Siege of Königsberg? Even the Battle of Berlin with King Tigers and IS-2s? It could have been the greatest ♥♥♥♥ ever! Instead we got a launch with stupid politics, a director that said a line of utter meme worthy proportions, who got himself fired within two months of launch, a hacker problem of mythical scale with bugger all offical regulation, the LATE inclusion of community servers and the IDIOTIC decision to make them free, inclusion of Women in the Wehrmacht, the US Army, the Royal Army as well as the the Imperial Japanese Army, that is historically inaccurate and during a time when gamers were getting sick of identity-politics and a later Battlefield game that only recently got player-numbers back because they put the game down to 10 bucks. Let this be a cautionary tale and hope for better things. Thanks for coming to my TET talk. Oh you want to know if you should get the game? Uhhh..... Wait for a sale like you always should, dumbass.

I truly believe that the Battlefield franchise was a criminally underrated series based on what it had to offer in comparison to other games and franchise of this genre. Battlefield V might have been the last truly great entry in the franchise and I firmly believe it is one of, if not the best. Battlefield V may not have been the most historically accurate game, but the gameplay, the maps and especially the audio made it extremely difficult not to be immersed in the setting the game takes place in. The game only gets better when you play with friends, but the comradery you can find in any teammate when trying to achieve a common goal makes every match an experience like no other. So many people that use bots. The biggest challenge is finding a server without one, where you can briefly enjoy this game. There are a lot of other flaws, but those only matter if you don't get shot instantly from across the map.

Let's get it started. +Incredibly beautiful. The game looks amazing, I'm not sure I've ever seen anything like this in a shooter. I had a very strong desire to set the settings to ultra and just walk around the maps on empty servers to look at this beauty. The developers' attention to detail has always been at a high level. +Specializations. The mechanics have been updated and the perks are now immediately available, but the game is still most effective in a squad, which is a plus as it's fun. The classes have been redesigned and are now better and more balanced. +Minor new mechanics and reworked old mechanics. First aid kits, ammo, supply boxes, the ability to revive a squad member, and rewards for squad points are done very well and fit into the gameplay. The absence of an actual wallhack when spotting, as in BF4, is also a big plus. +Official servers. No more sh!tty rules from stupid admins, no more permanent bans for politely telling the admins why their rules are sh!tty. It's amazing that there are no class restrictions, no nukes, no rebalancing and other idiotic things. We can just play the way we like. =Squad. Playing in a squad with friends is just as damn fun and highly effective as playing with random people in your squad is boring and unproductive. +/-Recon class. This has become much more useful. You can now spot enemies in an area with the Flare Gun and when hit. Why isn't this a real plus? The fact is that the Battlefield games have a recon class and no sniper class, which does not give us the opportunity to get the classic sniper experience. Killсam will always shows your position when you kill somebody and your rifle will never kill with a single shot on a body. +/-Maps. As I said earlier, appearance is amazing. But there are few of them and many of them are unbalanced and boring. +/-HUD settings. It's just as customizable as in BF4, but now we're finally spared from the disgusting battlelog, and we can directly join a friend without any problems. This should be in games by default so it is not a really plus and in this case DICE fixed their mistakes. -Cheaters. The official servers have only one problem - the lack of human moderation and/or a kick voting system. The anti-cheat system does not work here at all, and a couple of years ago EA initiated the free giveaway of an unlimited number of copies of the game through Amazon. As a result, even if the cheaters is banned, they can easily buy a new account on third-party sites for a very small price, or perhaps they have already created a dozen accounts for himself during that giveaway. This is a huge problem, in about half of all matches you will encounter a cheater. If you suspect cheating, but you are not sure whether to send a report, I recommend checking the player's nickname on the bfvhackers website. -Balance. Unfortunately, traditionally everything is very bad. Incredible high rate of fire + good control of some types of weapons (Type 2A, etc.), automatic shotguns (several oneshots per second), DMR, prone playstyle with a machine gun - huge advantages. The aircraft have been made even more powerful and you will die from them a lot, the situation is much worse than in BF4, because here they mainly attack infantry. DICE don't know what balance is and this game is no exception. The biggest cons. -Gadget keys. At critical moments, they may simply not work literally up to a minute. This doesn't happen often, but it's very frustrating because the game simply won't let you use your first kit. -Unlocking. Not only are newcomers forced to compete with more experienced players, but they don’t even have specializations for weapons from the start and they have to unlock them. The stupidest trend and I have no idea why all shooters have this annoying thing. -No test range. BF4 had a great test range where you could set up settings and adjust your classes. The test range in BF5 is terrible. You can't set up classes and test them, and there aren't enough interactions to fine-tune HUD and other things. -Community. It's disgusting here too. The developers deliberately added imbalanced weapons to retain the casual audience, but the garbage community here plays almost with such weapons only. -Censorship. EA suppresses free speech all the time but this is truly a new level, I have never seen anything like this. Now the chat has a censor and some of your words will be replaced with "***". FC U EA. You are trash. -Support. DICE and EA don't care about their products. There is no chance that any of the above will be fixed. I must admit that this is quite an entertaining product. If you have even one person willing to share multiplayer gameplay with you, I highly recommend it. BF5 is vastly superior to BF4 in almost every way. But the fact is that both of these games have common cons that are most important to the gameplay. A good gaming experience is a consequence of playing cooperatively with friends, and not the merit of the game itself. Therefore, playing alone is very uninteresting, boring and annoying due to the imbalance. Verdict. Objectively the game is very bad. Terrible balance and community, lots of cheaters - are the main cons that make the game unplayable. However, playing in a squad can keep you here for a while. I'd like the game to get a few patches, but since no one cares about it, I wish it dead. The "Not Recommended" was given because the game doesn't deserve the 70% positive reviews it has on Steam. I think the % should be <40. p.s. The review has been updated as I have changed my mind on some aspects of the game. I dedicate these GIFs to EA:

This game is still holding up really well. It ain't no run and gun game, so if you're looking for that kind of BF game, check out BF1 and BF2042. Battlefield 5 plays fairly more tactical and you're going to use covers a lot. Unlike games that take an aracade-ish approach, in BF5, a .22 caliber to the head from half a mile sends you back to the deployment screen. Although, Team Deathmatch takes a different approach and encourages aggressive playstyles, as well as Firestorm (Battle Royale) which unfortunately is dead and almost impossible to find a lobby in. You're likely to wait 20 minutes to find a solo game and the lobby still wouldn't be full. That's a shame cause Firestorm is really fun. The campaign is probably one of the best I've ever played and it's immersion could mark my words. Instead of playing mission after mission as most campaigns force you to, in BF5, the missions are an open world battleground in which you decide in what order you should get your tasks done. The storyline itself also is one of the best out there. Last but not least, there are no pay to win bundles. I was surprised to see that an EA game isn't based on microtransactions. The game is fun and worth buying even in 2023.

Battlefield 5 is an exciting game full of dynamics and epic battles. The graphics in the game are incredibly realistic, the world is recreated with stunning detail, and every detail is worked out to perfection. One of the most impressive features of Battlefield 5 is the scale of the battles. You can fight on huge maps, including destructible surrounding objects, which gives the game the feeling of a real war. Battles unfold in various theatres of war, such as Europe, Asia and Africa, allowing players to immerse themselves in a diverse history. A huge selection of weapons and equipment also adds variety to the game. You can choose between different classes, each with unique skills and capabilities. Various types of weapons are available, from rifles and pistols to tanks and aeroplanes. The availability of different modes of transport allows players to choose the appropriate tactics and strategy in battle. The multiplayer component in Battlefield 5 also leaves a pleasant impression. It offers various modes and maps where players can fight with other players around the world. The progression system and various achievements give the game durability and increase motivation to continue the game. However, some players may find some issues in the gameplay balance. Some weapons and classes may seem too strong or weak in comparison with others, which may cause some dissatisfaction among experienced players. Also, some players note some technical problems and errors in the game, although the developers are actively working to fix these problems. In general, Battlefield 5 is an exciting and serious game that allows you to plunge into the atmosphere of war and fight epic battles. Despite some problems, the game has great potential and is sure to please fans of the series and fans of shooters in general.

I bought the game despite the reviews saying the game is filled with cheaters because of the few people saying community servers are clean and moderated. It turns out, out of all the community servers there are only a few which have a suitable enough ping to play on, and even fewer are actually moderated. I would say half (feels like more than half though) of community servers that I've tried are allowing cheaters. As for the cheating, I've seen plenty of people speed hacking. I think thats the more common (and obvious to spot) cheat. I found 2 players in a match which were suspiciously consistent and fast at hitting shots. One of them was using a sniper and was headshotting people instantly. The other was using a machine gun and was also killing me before I had the chance to even spot him after peeking out of cover. Both of them had an irregularly high score compared to most other players. Both of them were also hitting me behind walls/through terrain every once in a while. I bought the game on sale for 12 bucks, and I would say its not worth any more than that in its current state. Absolutely do not recommend spending full price on this. Its a fun game but its been ruined by cheaters and by EA/Dice unwilling to moderate it in any meaningful way.

Battlefield 5 is an exciting game full of dynamics and epic battles. The graphics in the game are incredibly realistic, the world is recreated with stunning detail, and every detail is worked out to perfection. One of the most impressive features of Battlefield 5 is the scale of the battles. You can fight on huge maps, including destructible surrounding objects, which gives the game the feeling of a real war. Battles unfold in various theaters of war, such as Europe, Asia and Africa, allowing players to immerse themselves in a diverse history. A huge selection of weapons and equipment also adds variety to the game. You can choose between different classes, each with unique skills and capabilities. Various types of weapons are available, from rifles and pistols to tanks and airplanes. The availability of different modes of transport allows players to choose the appropriate tactics and strategy in battle. The multiplayer component in Battlefield 5 also leaves a pleasant impression. It offers various modes and maps where players can fight with other players around the world. The progression system and various achievements give the game durability and increase motivation to continue the game. However, some players may find some issues in the gameplay balance. Some weapons and classes may seem too strong or weak in comparison with others, which may cause some dissatisfaction among experienced players. Also, some players note some technical problems and errors in the game, although the developers are actively working to fix these problems. In general, Battlefield 5 is an exciting and serious game that allows you to plunge into the atmosphere of war and fight epic battles. Despite some problems, the game has great potential and is sure to please fans of the series and fans of shooters in general.

Warm water: (105-115 degrees)- to activate the yeast. Active Dry yeast: Instant or rapid rise yeast can be substituted, following my adaption notes in the recipe card. Granulated sugar or honey: the sugar is used to “feed” the yeast and tenderize the bread. Salt: to enhance flavor Oil: Vegetable or canola oil, or melted butter could be substituted Flour: Bread Flour or All-Purpose Flour can both be used with no changes to the recipe. The exact amount of flour used will vary depending on different factors (altitude/humidity etc.). What matters is the texture of the dough. It should be smooth and pull away from the sides of the bowl. It’s important not to add too much flour or your bread will be dense. The dough should be just slightly sticky when touched with a clean finger.

I think it's a given that future entries of games and movies should be generally better than their previous installments. Battlefield V, in many aspects, is far-and-away an improvement over it's predecessor, Battlefield 1. Movement, gun-play, and the overall game-play loop sees greatly appreciated changes and updates, that give players more freedom and options in the Battlefield sandbox. Additions like crouch-running offers flexibility in a player's tactical toolkit, and the Fortifications system allow individual squads and players to better contribute to the entire team's success, and provides more ability and incentive to defend objectives. The Reinforcements system further promotes team-play and cohesiveness within squads, by giving squad leaders strong rewards for setting and completing orders, and allowing them to turn the tide of an engagement. There are an innumerable other changes I could mention; in essence, Battlefield V is utterly, an unequivocal technical and game-play improvement over Battlefield 1. For that reason I recommend BFV to people to have played and enjoyed Battlefield 1; though for all the improvements of BFV, in it's current state it is somewhat buggy, and has a serious issue with blatant cheaters in many servers.

This is a fun game about half of the time if you get a full lobby on a good map. Some maps you will lose 9/10 times if you're one the wrong side simply because the enemy team can field more armor than you can. Tanks in this game are busted where they are near impossible to take out as infantry unless you have multiple guys shooting them with bazookas because your sticky bombs are useless since tanks can sit in third person and will see you coming from 20 meters away. By far the biggest issue though is the number of cheaters. Out of every 10 games you will run into cheaters at least twice. The worst part is these guys are blatant and it takes days for them to get banned. They will get mass reported for aimbotting you 200 meters away in a tank turret or speed hacking straight to you and killing you 10 seconds after spawning and then will follow you into the next game for about 2 hours. Buy at your own risk.

The story campaign feels like rushed expansion pack DLC. I'm shocked that such a well known developer would ever release something this devoid of effort. -The maps are small and stories short. -Characters get hung up on invisible objects and run in place. -Your shots frequently don't register. -Any enemy that mounts a turret becomes impervious to gunfire from the front. Even when you shoot them in their fully exposed heads. -With some of the machine guns you can hip fire a full 30 round clip at an enemy 6 feet in front of you and not hit them once. Honestly, I've seen lone developers kitbash better and more polished games

I would not recommend this game to anyone for anything but the solo story mode. The multiplayer is 90% cheaters, as EA Games doesn't have an effective cheat-prevention module. Channels on YouTube highlight cheaters who can show all enemies on their screen, alter the movement/speed of their own character to supernatural levels, shoot through walls and buildings, and even kick people off the servers to reduce the opposing team to half or quarter capacity, thus ensuring their win. I've recorded some "spectator" mode footage myself, and noted that players flying planes were bots: they had 0 bombs on their planes, and yet still were able to drop 8 - 12 bombs per pass. I've also recorded gameplay of the cheaters' health being replenished from 10% back to full 100% in 3 seconds, unlimited ammunition, and some type of script they run on their server connection that enhances the lethality of shots to the point that they don't even need to be firing close to you in order to kill you. Additionally, on their mini map, the cheaters have MW3-style full UAV mode, seeing where you are at all times on the map. softlocked lmao A Screenshot of Battlefield™ V By: Ultra This is really unfortunate, that a wonderfully-made game has such a short shelf-life. This game answers my prayers for a war game with great aesthetics & interplay; is not suffocated by activity and "paranormal" attributes given to soldiers, such as the COD/Modern Warfare dynasty -- except for one thing: the "teleportation" element of Snipers' radios allowing any players to enter at that point. I'm so over the "supernatural" realm entering into otherwise "realistic" games. Battlefield has a very clever & realistic attention to sound (utilizing echo and reverb), realistic object spacing & realistic timing, but the movement -- the distance a character can cover at running speed -- is a little stretched. The story lines that are intriguing. I played the solo missions in Norway as my first experience; the lush environment and character freewill was hypnotizing. A shame this game has gone in the trash.

Great game. Fun with friends and sadly riddled with cheaters. The gun animations are absoluteluy amazing. Many probably were to a degree fed up with ww2 weapons. But I honestly have to say this game makes me love them even more. The detailed barrel swap animation for both the MG34 and the MG42 is something not a lot of other games can boast they have. The animation team truly did an amazing job. It's a shame some of this quality got lost in the 2042 / Portal installment. I have had many fun moments both reading the chat and playing with my friends. This game was harshly judged due to it's customization freedom. But I have to say, if you can overlook that, play the game. This game's never meant to be a ww2 sim or something of the likes. Slap any uniform you want on your soldier, use the most ridicolous gun ever and have a blast.

IMPORTANT UPDATE: Since creating this review most european ROBOT Servers have been removed since it was found out that virtually everybody hosting a ROBOT Server cheated themselves. So yeah, welcome to BFV --- End Update Normal matchmaking doesn't work on public servers thanks to cheaters en mass, so the first recommendation you will get, if you google this problem, is to go to community servers => search for servers with [ROBOT] in their name. However, most of those don't really use anti cheat protection, you will commonly find people will 100 kills to 4 deaths or something of the sort. The server where you have that protection are still a solid gaming experience, however, according to the data they show you can still expect at least 1% of players to be cheaters - Just are reminder, those 1% of people playing are found out cheaters on community servers with extra protection, so you can imagine the amount of unreported or not found cases. And way, way more on the official server without any protection at all. Since community servers are run by private persons, you can be banned for no reason at all at any time from that server. And some of them have, weirdly enough, strong "Anti-China talk not allowed" rules. I'm still having fun, 2 of 3 games are a solid experience, no trouble finding games as of 10/23, but if a friend came to me and ask if he should buy BFV, it would be a no.

the overall gameplay and multiplayer are pretty fun. i like how sniping feels in this game. thats about all the good i have to say about this game at the moment. admited the game is basically dead at this point and has been for a while. im not a fan of the last few games that i litterally just had. finally got some games where someone wasnt blatantly cheating, and yet i spent a good 20min of that game spawning and either instantly dying because of spawn campers either in tanks or dive bombing in planes. to even just a random dude camped right next to a spawn point so they can shotgun you instantly. dont get me wrong i get it its a game. but ive been on both sides of that, and it isnt fun spending most of the 30 minute game doing nothing either because you keep dying or because you cant ♥♥♥♥♥♥ find anyone. thats if you get a game without a cheater. if you do there is no question about it. ive had a few games where my bullets litteraly would hit someone they ♥♥♥♥ thier head back you get the blood animation and them continue to shoot at you. this is while im using a sniper. but didnt get a hit marker. either that or the lag gets to it and goes right through. but this is a base game issue that has to do more with how it handles lag. with 64 players in a lobby sometimes things happen and whatever no big deal. but when its like that the entire game it feels like youve been given a nerf gun in a gun fight against 8 people with real 240 bravos. when you get a cheater it makes that worse. everything from instant respawn. (they get ragdolled by a tank, then after thier body lands thier up again and still shooting. saw someone do this 6 times in a row) to people basically just having god mode/speed hacks, infinate ammo spamming snipers at 500rpm like an lmg its dumb. all that and there is an increasing likelyhood that you log on and thier is no games active. (nobody else in the world is playing) ive logged in to find this a few times lately. at one point the servers were dedicated based on region alone. now if your country shares a native language with another they lump those sometimes as much as 4 regions togeather and thats the coomon servers for that area. that and private games really are all ive seen active. you may get lucky durring the weekend and get to play a few actually decent games. but aside from that the game isnt worth it. its been long abandoned by ea, to include banning cheaters. i spent 7 dollars on this game and honestly it was fun while it lasted but it frustrates me how good this game could have still been let alone could be, if only ea stepped in and actually did thier part. i wouldnt spend 30-60 on this game in the current state its in. especially considering its not likely to change

Battlefield V is like the ultimate spicy adventure, and speaking of spice, here's a recipe for a hot sauce that'll leave you sweating bullets : **Ingredients:** - 10-12 spicy chili peppers (choose your heat level) - 3 cloves of garlic - 1 small onion - 1 cup distilled white vinegar - 1 teaspoon salt - 1 teaspoon sugar - A pinch of gunpowder (just kidding!) **Instructions:** 1. Roast the chili peppers, garlic, and onion in a hot skillet until they're slightly charred and aromatic. This step adds some smoky flavor to your sauce, just like the fiery explosions in Battlefield V. 2. Remove the stems from the peppers and roughly chop the roasted ingredients. 3. In a blender, combine the roasted peppers, garlic, and onion with vinegar, salt, and sugar. Blitz it until you have a smooth, fiery concoction that's hotter than a tank battle in the game. 4. Transfer your homemade hot sauce to a bottle and let it cool down, just like you cool down after an intense round of Battlefield V. Now, with your homemade hot sauce in hand, you're ready for some scorching action in Battlefield V. It's the perfect way to add some heat to your gaming sessions, both on the screen and on your plate! 🔥🎮

This game is an example of the absolute s*it show that is EA Dice. In theory, this is a good, squad based game. There is a lot of good things about it, in terms of mechanics and ability to enjoy WW2 tanks, planes and armoured vehicles. But it is beyond broken. I have played my final game, in a map where the enemy team were able to constantly call artillery strikes. This is a new hack, in addition to the known hacks, eg wall hack, aim bot, and there are mods to disable smoke or foliage etc. There has been many problems with the hacks in this game and it has been known for a long time. New hacks are coming out where you can make the whole enemy team respawn instantly. That means any plane that was used crashes, and any tank the team had blows up/is taken by the other team. There is no chance against cheats and it is the fault of EA Dice. It is an absolute s*it show and everyone who has ever brought it should get their money back AND compensation for time wasted. This game should be removed from Steam along with every EA Dice game ever. They should never be allowed on Steam again.
